channel.title: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
channel.description:
How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
Example: Dummy To Train On
Found This Objects.cfg file: (This is whats inside...) [code]//Face: -3 = south | -2 = east | -1 = north | 0 = west //Type: 1 = Y + 1 | 2 = X + 1 | 3 = Y - 1 | 4 = X - 1 //-------objID--objX----objY----height--face----type----open? object = 1536 3215 3225 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1536 3215 3211 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1530 3208 3211 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1536 3207 3217 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1530 3226 3214 0 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1530 3226 3223 0 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1530 3207 3210 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1536 3207 3214 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1536 3207 3222 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1530 3207 3227 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle object = 1533 3238 3210 0 -3 4 false Lumbridge object = 1530 3234 3207 0 -1 2 false Lumbridge object = 1531 3233 3203 0 -1 2 true Lumbridge object = 1530 3235 3198 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge object = 1530 3247 3193 0 -1 4 false Lumbridge object = 1530 3230 3235 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge object = 1530 3228 3240 0 -3 2 false Lumbridge
[ENDOFOBJECTLIST][/code]
And If Someone Could Explain To Me What The "Type" And "Open" Categories Do...

item.title: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

I know this since i kinda made it o.O .
Ok in your client.java search

public void NewObjects()

Then you should see somethin like this

makeGlobalObject(3099, 3573, 6009, 0, 10);//blue fire

Ok let me explain the things inside.3099 is the X coord.3573 is the Y coord.6009 is the object id.0 is the height or the way its facing (leave it the same).10 is…Leave it the same basically.//Blue Fire = The name of the object (basically used to find it if needed).

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?

item.title: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Not which way you want it to go when you click it. Its a boolean, i.e. whether you want it to change position when you clikc on it afaik.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?

item.title: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

ok type is like…

10 = objects like chairs,dummies.haybales
0 = objects like doors,walls
4= wall objects like windows and pictures
22 = floor objects like carpet and rugs

open is which way you want it to face when you click it

hope this helps

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?

item.title: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
item.dc:creator: @Uber_Newb Uber Newb
item.description:
@Uber_Newb wrote:

How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?

Example: Dummy To Train On

Found This Objects.cfg file: (This is whats inside…)

[code]//Face: -3 = south | -2 = east | -1 = north | 0 = west
//Type: 1 = Y + 1 | 2 = X + 1 | 3 = Y - 1 | 4 = X - 1
//-------objID–objX----objY----height–face----type----open?
object = 1536 3215 3225 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1536 3215 3211 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1530 3208 3211 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1536 3207 3217 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1530 3226 3214 0 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1530 3226 3223 0 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1530 3207 3210 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1536 3207 3214 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1536 3207 3222 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1530 3207 3227 1 -3 2 false Lumbridge Castle
object = 1533 3238 3210 0 -3 4 false Lumbridge
object = 1530 3234 3207 0 -1 2 false Lumbridge
object = 1531 3233 3203 0 -1 2 true Lumbridge
object = 1530 3235 3198 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge
object = 1530 3247 3193 0 -1 4 false Lumbridge
object = 1530 3230 3235 0 -2 1 false Lumbridge
object = 1530 3228 3240 0 -3 2 false Lumbridge

[ENDOFOBJECTLIST][/code]

And If Someone Could Explain To Me What The “Type” And “Open” Categories Do…

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add an Object to JordieScape (Latest Version)?
